associate_staff.name: Danielle Gleave
associate_staff.profile: graduated with an Integrated Studies BA from UVU which combines her Writing Studies and Constitutional Studies minors. She has contributed to the Utah 1895 and Illinois 1970 state constitutional convention projects. Using Quill as a research tool and expanding that option for K-12 students has been the most rewarding aspect of her involvement with Quill.

associate_staff.name: Christopher Vizcardo
associate_staff.profile: is senior at Utah Valley University, majoring in Political Science with an emphasis in Political Philosophy and Public Policy and minoring in Constitutional Studies. He was born in the Andean city of Huaraz, Peru. His family moved to Utah when he was a child where he has lived ever since. From 2014-16 he served an as LDS missionary in New England. He speaks both Spanish and English and is interested in learning about Latin-American history and culture. Chris hopes to go on to law school to continue his study of constitutional issues.

associate_staff.name: Mary Hill
associate_staff.profile: is junior at Utah Valley University majoring in Political Science with a minor in Constitutional Studies. She plans to obtain her juris doctor and work as a political analyst. She hopes to study the preservation of rights given in the First Amendment.

associate_staff.name: Kiana McAllister
associate_staff.profile: Kiana McAllister recently graduated from Pembroke College, University of Oxford, with an MSt in Intellectual History. She works as the UVU CCS Documentary Editor on the Quill Project, providing editorial support on the National Archives Grant Projects, the National Endowment for the Humanities Projects, and the 1970 Illinois State Constitutional Convention Project. She is also working as a researcher on the Declaration of Independence Project.

associate_staff.name: Matt Rands
associate_staff.profile: is a senior at Utah Valley University and majoring in Political Science with an emphasis in Political Philosophy and Public Policy along with minors in Constitutional Studies and Spanish. He served as a missionary for the Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-Day Saints in the Bolivia Santa Cruz Mission. Since 2012, Matthew has been enlisted as a parachute rigger for the Utah National Guard. He anticipates to commission as an Army Lieutenant after graduation of ROTC and become a JAG officer upon completion of Law school.

associate_staff.name: Ashton Earl
associate_staff.profile: is sophomore at Utah Valley University studying Economics and History and minoring in Constitutional Studies. He is from the thriving agricultural metropolis of Hermiston, Oregon.  He aspires to attend law school, practice constitutional law, and convince his beautiful wife to keep him along the way.

associate_staff.name: Edward Goebel
associate_staff.profile: Edward is a senior at Utah Valley University majoring in Political Science with a Global Politics Emphasis and a double minor in Constitutional Studies and National Security. He is a native of Utah and enjoys the mountains in winter. He served a mission for the Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-Day Saints in Washington State from 2016-2018 and is very grateful to live in a country where religious liberty is constitutionally protected. He is fascinated with history and how it continues to be made. Consequently, he hopes to do graduate studies in area studies or foreign policy and then work for the federal government doing analysis of near-peer power competition.

associate_staff.name: Antony Jackson
associate_staff.profile:
is a senior at Utah Valley University majoring in political science with an emphasis in political philosophy and minoring in constitutional studies and philosophy. He is from the small town of Punalu'u, Hawai'i. He served an LDS Mission in the Dakotas from 2015 to 2017. 
Antony joined The Quill Project in 2019 and has worked on the 1895 Utah Constitutional Convention project and is currently working on the 1969-1970 Illinois Constitutional Convention. He finds working on The Quill Project extremely fulfilling as they have allowed him to realize his research interest in state constitutionalism. He would like to continue his research on state constitutions and American constitutionalism and legal thought.
Antony loves to watch football and rugby. He enjoys Hawaiian and Korean food. Most of all, he enjoys spendigng his free time with his family.

associate_staff.name: Erica Croft
associate_staff.profile: Erica is a Senior in Political Science with a Constitutional Studies minor at Utah Valley University. She participated in the 1895 Utah Constitutional Convention project and currently she works on the Reconstruction Amendment project.

associate_staff.name: Sean Beienburg
associate_staff.profile:
is the director of the Living Repository of the Arizona Constitution project. Sean's teaching and research interests include the Constitution and constitutional law, American political development and American political thought, federalism and state constitutionalism/politics, executive power (both presidential and gubernatorial), parties and interest groups, 19th and early 20th century political and constitutional history, and Prohibition.

He is the author of Prohibition, the Constitution, and States' Rights  (published by the University of Chicago Press, 2019) and is finishing another book on states as constitutional interpreters and progressive federalists in the progressive and New Deal eras.
associate_staff.title: Dr

associate_staff.name: Dr Nicholas Jacobs
associate_staff.profile: is a Faculty Research Associate at Arizona State University and a Faculty Fellow in the Department of Government at Colby College. His research focuses on executive-branch policymaking and intergovernmental politics.

associate_staff.name: Joseph Andersen-Stanley
associate_staff.profile: Joseph Andersen-Stanley is a senior at Utah Valley University majoring in Political Science and minoring in Philosophy and Constitutional Studies. He has been working on the Quill project since May 2019, and has been a Co-Team Lead over the NEH Project since February 2020. Joseph plans to go to graduate school and aspires to be a professor teaching political science. The Quill project has allowed him to get a deep dive into research, political philosophy and constitutionalism as an undergraduate, which helps prepare him for graduate school and beyond.

associate_staff.name: Nikola Dragacevac
associate_staff.profile: Nikola Dragacevac is an Undergraduate Computer Science student at King's College London. His research interests include Data Visualization and Algorithm Design.

associate_staff.name: Hannah Aurora Miller
associate_staff.profile: Aurora is a senior at Utah Valley University, majoring in Psychology. They are from Hawai'i, and have worked on the 19th Amendment Project and the 1970 Illinois Convention. They enjoy working with Quill because of their fascination with constitutions, and hope to continue studying various constitutions.

associate_staff.name: Hector  Manzanarez
associate_staff.profile:
Current Senior, majoring in Political Science with a minor in Constitutional Studies. 
Team Lead for the National Endowment for the Humanities Project in Quill. Currently working on the modeling of the Idaho Constituonal Convention.

associate_staff.name: Ashlynn Poelman
associate_staff.profile: A senior at Utah Valley University, Ashlynn, is majoring in Political Science with an emphasis in Public Administration and Policy. She is currently working on both the NEH Grant-funded Wyoming and Idaho Quill projects. The Quill Project has surrounded Ashlynn with both peers and mentors that are curious and resourceful. She has learned new research methods and has gained more respect for historical policymakers.

associate_staff.name: Mizuki Hassell
associate_staff.profile: Mizuki is majoring in Political Science and minoring in National Security Studies. She previously worked on the 19th Amendment project and is currently working on the Reconstruction projects, specifically the 14th and 15th Amendment projects. Mizuki thoroughly enjoys and feels humbled to have the opportunity to engage intimately and analyze congressional behavior.

associate_staff.name: Daniel Little
associate_staff.profile: Daniel is a senior studying political science and minoring in constitutional studies. Currently he is working on the Idaho project and has worked on the Wyoming project. He enjoys the culture of the Center of Constitutional Studies and the "inside look" Quill grants into state constitutionalism.

associate_staff.name: Ethan Bassett
associate_staff.profile: Ethan Bassett studies Political Science and Constitutional Studies at Utah Valley University. He has been working on The Quill Project since 2020 and has contributed to the Wyoming and Illinois State Convention Projects. He is passionate about the promotion of constitutional literacy.

associate_staff.name: Britt Olson
associate_staff.profile: I am a Political Science major working on the 1970 Illinois constitution project. I have always greatly enjoyed history and government the Quill Project has created the opportunity to combine these interests and help provide a resource for others to engage as well.

associate_staff.name: Andrew Elder
associate_staff.profile: I am majoring in political science and minoring in constitutional studies. I currently work with the Reconstruction Amendments Team for the 13th, 14th, and 15th amendments. Working with quill offers me a unique opportunity to research, study, and learn about the history and intent behind major legal events of the U.S.

associate_staff.name: David Renda
associate_staff.profile: History and Social Studies Education Major at Utah Valley University. Hired at the Center for Constitutional Studies in Sept. 2020. Currently working on the Illinois Constitutional Convention.

associate_staff.name: Hannah Thayne
associate_staff.profile: I am a senior majoring in political science and minoring in constitutional studies. I am on the NEH team, working on the Wyoming and Idaho conventions. Working at the Center and on Quill has let me work in my own way. My schedule is flexible, they let me prioritize my classes, and I work with the best people.

associate_staff.name: Tyler Cooper
associate_staff.profile: I'm a Political Science major with an emphasis in American Government working on the 1970 Illinois State Constitutional Convention.  Working at the Utah Valley University Center for Constitutional Studies is a great privilege that allows me to associate with the best people the world has to offer and provides an opportunity to work on projects that have real world significance.

associate_staff.name: Cashlyn English
associate_staff.profile: graduated from UVU in May of 2023 with a Bachelors in Philosophy with minors in Political Science and Constitutional Studies. She joined the Quill team in January 2021 and has worked on the Sixth Illinois 1970 Constitutional Convention, and the NEH Western States Project. She served as the project lead, NEH co-Lead and is currently the Quill project specialist. She enjoys working at the center and participating in rodeos while preparing for law school in the near future.

associate_staff.name: Justin Stapley
associate_staff.profile: Justin is a student at Utah Valley University where he is majoring in Political Science with an emphasis in political theory as well as minoring in Constitutional Studies. He is assigned to the Illinois Convention of 1970 team. He joined the project because of his passion for understanding the origins of political thought and the way political principles become adopted into working constitutions and are crafted towards good governance.

associate_staff.name: Jacob Carlson
associate_staff.profile: is a lifetime resident of Orem, Utah. He is currently an undergrad student, studying Political Science, at Utah Valley University. Jacob has worked on the Illinois project for the entire duration of his time working for the Center for Constitutional Studies.

associate_staff.name: Adam  Smith
associate_staff.profile: earned a Bachelor's degree in Political Science from Utah Valley University emphasizing Political Philosophy & Public Law in 2025 and is now pursuing a Master's degree in Constitutional Government, Civics, & Law at UVU. They are currently a team member of the 1857 Minnesota Constitutional Convention project. They plan to use their experience with the Quill project to enrich their graduate studies with the intent of earning a PhD to facilitate postdoctoral research in political theory, focusing particularly on deliberative democratic theory and political ethics from an egalitarian perspective.

associate_staff.name: Sam Jafek
associate_staff.profile: is from San Diego, California. He is currently studying Professional Writing at Brigham Young University and hopes to practice Constitutional Law.

associate_staff.name: Ethan Petersen
associate_staff.profile: Graduated from Utah Valley University in December of 2024 with his Bachelor's Degree in History. He enjoys reading science fiction and spending time with his wife and two cats.

core_staff.name: Alfie Abdul-Rahman
core_staff.profile: Dr Alfie Abdul-Rahman is a Lecturer in Computer Science at the Department of Informatics, King's College London. Her research interests include information visualization, human-computer interaction, user-centered design of visualization applications, and user studies and evaluation.
core_staff.title: Dr

core_staff.name: Ruth Murray
core_staff.profile: is Quill's Deputy Director. She graduated from [The Queen’s College, Oxford](https://www.queens.ox.ac.uk) a long time ago and had experience in a variety of administrative roles in Oxford University before joining Quill. She assists the Director in developing Quill's strategic vision and external partnerships, and established Quill's Writing Peace research strand.

core_staff.name: Lauren Davis Jarnach
core_staff.profile:
completed her Master of Studies in English Literature at Oxford University in 2018. Lauren started with Quill as a Research Assistant in 2018 and rejoined the team some months later as the project's first Documentary Editor and then its first Senior Documentary Editor. She has worked on several projects during this time, including the 1787 U.S. Constitutional Convention, the 1789 U.S. Bill of Rights, and several U.S. state constitutions. She is currently working on the Constitution of India and the Constitution of Australia projects.

While studying for her undergraduate degree at the University of Alabama, Lauren was involved with the Mill Marginalia Research Project.

core_staff.name: Annabel Harris
core_staff.profile: Annabel Harris is a documentary editor currently working on the Writing Peace collection. She previously worked across the Civil Rights Amendments collection, particularly on the Thirteenth and Fourteenth Amendment projects and the Crittenden Convention.

core_staff.name: Martin Lewis-Dalgarno
core_staff.profile: Martin Lewis-Dalgarno is a software engineer and UI designer who joined the Quill Team in November 2022, after a year off as a stay-at-home Dad with his newborn son. Having worked in a variety of development roles and industries over the past decade, he’s excited to be bringing his expertise to build the next generation of Quill's Digital Platform.

core_staff.name: Holly Megson
core_staff.profile: is a senior documentary editor responsible for the current U.S. Constitutional projects in collaboration with Utah Valley University. Within this role she coordinates with faculty and student research assistants at UVU, oversees the National Archive Grant projects and the upcoming Declaration of Independence Project. Prior to joining Quill, she graduated from Pembroke College, University of Oxford, with a BA in History.

core_staff.name: Alexm Janusz
core_staff.profile: graduated from the University of the West of England in 2023 and is currently a Junior Back-End Software Engineer. In this role, Alex is focused on integrating and developing a new API for the Quill project, while also assisting Martin Lewis-Dalgarno in modernising the website's front-end.

core_staff.name: Maya Reilly
core_staff.profile: is an documentary editor at the Quill Project. She graduated from the University of York in 2023 with a BA in English and related Literature. Her current responsibilities include overseeing two National Archives Grant projects: the Kansas and Indiana State constitutions. Since starting, she has travelled twice to Utah Valley University to assist their student editors use the Quill platform.

former_associate_staff.name: Colten Sponseller
former_associate_staff.platform_team_name: Records of the 1787 Constitutional Convention (2016 Edition)
former_associate_staff.profile: worked on the Quill Project as a Wood Assistant of The Center for Constitutional Studies at Utah Valley University.

former_associate_staff.name: Matt Nolte
former_associate_staff.platform_team_name: Records of the 1787 Constitutional Convention (2016 Edition)

former_associate_staff.name: Lance Merrell
former_associate_staff.platform_team_name: Records of the 1787 Constitutional Convention (2016 Edition)

former_associate_staff.name: John Cummings
former_associate_staff.platform_team_name: Records of the 1787 Constitutional Convention (2016 Edition)

former_associate_staff.name: Mark Wait
former_associate_staff.profile: worked as a Wood Teaching and Research Assistant in the Center for Constitutional Studies, and a member of the Constitutional Studies Club. He had the opportunity to travel to Oxford University as part of his work on the Quill Project. Mark plans to pursue a Ph.D. in social sciences. He would like to start his career as a professor and eventually move to a position in higher education administration.

former_associate_staff.name: Lucie Saez
former_associate_staff.profile: is a Masters student at the University of Rennes. She worked with Quill on the pilot of the French National Conventions project in summer 2018. This pilot project was organized in conjunction with the Maison Francaise d'Oxford. It is hoped that the work that the French interns were able to carry out will result in a more substantial piece of work on the 1789 'Rights of Man and the Citizen', a document profoundly influenced by the American Revolution , and which provides an important contrast to the American Bill of Rights.

former_associate_staff.name: Gauthier Boucly
former_associate_staff.profile: is a Masters student at the Sorbonne. He worked with Quill on the pilot of the French National Conventions project in summer 2018. This pilot project was organized in conjunction with the Maison Francaise d'Oxford. It is hoped that the work that the French interns were able to carry out will result in a more substantial piece of work on the 1789 'Rights of Man and the Citizen', a document profoundly influenced by the American Revolution , and which provides an important contrast to the American Bill of Rights.

former_associate_staff.name: Hanna Paasivirta
former_associate_staff.platform_team_name: Universal Declaration of Human Rights Project

former_associate_staff.name: Kaelie Bodily
former_associate_staff.profile: was formerly a student at Utah Valley University where she studied Political Science and Constitutional Studies. During her time at the Center for Constitutional Studies she primarily contributed to the 1970 Illinois State Constitution Project. She is fluent in Italian and enjoys history, politics, and American Government.

former_associate_staff.name: Grace Dinsdale
former_associate_staff.profile: is currently pursuing a degree in History and Social Studies Education at Utah Valley University. She is from Tyler, Texas and is hoping to teach history at the secondary level and eventually go into state education policy.

former_associate_staff.name: Wilson Cole
former_associate_staff.profile: Senior history major and student research assistant at the Center for Constitutional Studies at Utah Valley University.

former_associate_staff.name: Brielle Paul
former_associate_staff.profile: is a senior at Brigham Young University pursuing a BA in English and Creative Writing. She is a team member of the 1859 Kansas Constitutional Convention project. Since starting, she has also been a member of the team modeling the Minnesota Republican Constitution Convention.

former_core_staff.name: Kat Howarth
former_core_staff.platform_team_name: Records of the 1787 Constitutional Convention (2016 Edition)

former_core_staff.name: Omer Gunes
former_core_staff.profile: is a Junior Research Fellow at Pembroke College, University of Oxford. He holds a DPhil degree in Computer Science from Oxford University. His research interests include Natural Language Processing, Information Extraction, and Deep Learning.
former_core_staff.title: Dr

former_core_staff.name: Nick Williford
former_core_staff.profile: is an Attorney at Law in Tennessee. After completing his Master of Studies at Oxford University, he worked for a number of months as a Research Assistant with Quill, focussed on the Bill of Rights. He continues to act as a legal advisor to the project.

former_core_staff.name: Kieran Hazzard
former_core_staff.profile: is a historian of British Radicalism and its combative relationship with the East India Company in the first half of the nineteenth century. His research seeks to redefine our understanding of empire in India during the early nineteenth century. Kieran joined Quill in 2018 as Research Assistant. He’s currently working on the US Constitutional Convention 1787.
former_core_staff.title: Dr

former_core_staff.name: Grace Penn
former_core_staff.profile: Grace Penn recently finished her Undergraduate Degree in English Language and Literature at the University of Oxford. She has now joined the Quill team as Trainee Digital Curator, which has allowed her to continue pursuing her interest in how the written word is formed and represented. She is particularly interested in how the project uses new technology to open a window onto texts that might otherwise seem dense or inaccessible.

former_core_staff.name: Jaden Bradshaw
former_core_staff.profile:
is a research assistant at the Center for Constitutional Studies at UVU. He has worked on various state constitutional convention projects, including Illinois, Kansas, Iowa, Ohio, & Minnesota (Republican).

Currently, he is working on his B.S. in History–Social Studies Education with a minor in School Health. Jaden aspires to become a secondary social studies teacher while working differing jobs in the summer, with long-term goals of becoming a school principal or lawyer.

Outside of work and study, he enjoys reading, camping, skiing, going to the gym, and beating his friends at a variety of party games, especially uno.

project_leads.name: Nicholas Cole
project_leads.profile: Senior Research Fellow at Pembroke College, Oxford. Director of the Quill Project.
project_leads.title: Dr
